name: downloadertask
friendlyName: BMC AMI DevX Source Code Download
description: Task is used for downloading source from Code Pipeline Repository or containers like Assignment, Set or Release.
author: BMC Software

inputs.name: cesUrl
inputs.label: CES URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: This field specifies the CES URL. Host connections with CES url can be configured in the Common Configuration Extension.

inputs.name: connectionId
inputs.label: Host Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: This field specifies the host connection associated with a CES URL. Host connections with CES url can be configured in the Common Configuration Extension.

inputs.name: runtimeConfig
inputs.label: Runtime Configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown: The host runtime configuration. See ISPW administrator for valid value. If the value is empty, leave it blank. Example: FOOBAR.

inputs.name: authenticationType
inputs.label: Authentication :
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select either Username-Password or PFX Certificate

inputs.name: cesSecretToken
inputs.label: CES secret token
inputs.helpMarkDown: The available CES secret token to perform Code Pipeline actions for Rest API call. In this feild, please pass pipeline variable name which is storing CES secret token as secret in Azure pipeline. Example $(cesToken).

inputs.name: keyvaultName
inputs.label: Key Vault
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of an existing key vault

inputs.name: certificateName
inputs.label: Certificate Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of certificate as added in Keyvault

inputs.name: sourceDownloadLocation
inputs.label: Source Download Location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Absolute path to a directory where source will be downloaded to . Example: C:\TopazISPW\DownloadedSource.

inputs.name: downloadSourceType
inputs.label: Download Source from:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Download source from Code Pipeline repository or different containers types (Assignment/Set/Release).

inputs.name: containerType
inputs.label: Container Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: The container type for which you intend to download elements: Assignment, Set or Release. Example: Assignment.

inputs.name: containerId
inputs.label: Container Id
inputs.helpMarkDown: The id of container for which you intend to download elements. Example: Kate123456.

inputs.name: componentType
inputs.label: Component Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Component type which needs to be downloaded. Example: COB.

inputs.name: stream
inputs.label: Stream
inputs.helpMarkDown: The two to eight character code that defines the application structure with which the application is associated.

inputs.name: application
inputs.label: Application
inputs.helpMarkDown: The container's primary application code. Containers may include components from multiple applications.

inputs.name: subAppl
inputs.label: SubAppl
inputs.helpMarkDown: The container's primary subapplication code. Containers may include components from multiple subapplications.

inputs.name: taskLevel
inputs.label: Level
inputs.helpMarkDown: The life cycle level. Example: DEV1.

inputs.name: repositoryLevel
inputs.label: Level
inputs.helpMarkDown: The life cycle level. Example: DEV1.

inputs.name: levelOption
inputs.label: Level Option
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select one of the following: Selected level only to display only components at the selected life cycle level in the view. First found in level and above to display the first version found of each component at the selected level and above.

options.FirstFoundLevelAndAbove: First found in level and above

inputs.name: componentTypes
inputs.label: Component types
inputs.helpMarkDown: A comma-separated list of the component types on which to filter, for example, 'COB, COPY, JOB, JAVA'. Space is required after comma. If the Application Root Folders filter is enabled, filtering will be constrained to components outside of a folder structure.

inputs.name: applicationRootFolderNames
inputs.label: Application root folder names
inputs.helpMarkDown: A comma-separated list of the application root folders' names on which to filter, for example, 'folder1, folder2, folder3'. Application root folders are the top-level folders under the application. All contents of the folders will be returned regardless of the Components filter value.

inputs.name: downloadUnchangedSource
inputs.label: Force download of unchanged source
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check this option if you want to download unchanged source.

inputs.name: downloadIncludes
inputs.label: Download related includes
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check this option if you want to download related includes eg.Copybooks, Header Files etc.

inputs.name: downloadCompileOnly
inputs.label: Download with compile only
inputs.helpMarkDown: When this box is checked, all files matching the filter will be downloaded, including Compile Only tasks.

inputs.name: trustAllCerts
inputs.label: Trust all Certificates
inputs.helpMarkDown:
This allows you to trust self-signed server certificates.
>Enabling this is not recommended.
